page.title: 08Town Walls of Sandwich.
page.content: The old historic town walls of Sandwich are still very much in evidence. Many people believe these are one of the best things about Sandwich. They have large and beautiful yew trees on either side presenting the walker with a lovely avenue. Along most of the walls there are trees of some sort. The steps and hand rails are clean and upright with no sign of rotting. There are some cast iron railings which, if removed, would present a much nicer and complete view. Also the flower beds along the walkway add too much formality and could easily be replaced with shrub or trees which would be more in keeping with the rest of the walk. There are two different views from the walls. On one hand there is the rurality of the river and park; on the other is the old part of the town. The walls are important to tourism.
